quote: If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything.
author: Mark Twain

quote: The truth will set you free, but first it will piss you off.
author: Joe Klaas

quote: Three things cannot be long hidden: the sun, the moon, and the truth.
author: Buddha

quote: In a time of deceit telling the truth is a revolutionary act.
author: George Orwell

quote: Honesty is the first chapter in the book of wisdom.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: Rather than love, than money, than fame, give me truth.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Truth is stranger than fiction.
author: Lord Byron

quote: The truth will out.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Facts do not cease to exist because they are ignored.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: If you want the truth to be spoken write it on your heart.
author: William Makepeace Thackeray

quote: The truth is incontrovertible. Panic may resent it; ignorance may deride it; malice may distort it; but there it is.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: A lie can travel halfway around the world while the truth is putting on its shoes.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Truth is beautiful, without doubt; but so are lies.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Whoever is careless with the truth in small matters cannot be trusted with important matters.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Truth is powerful and it prevails.
author: Sojourner Truth

quote: All truth passes through three stages. First, it is ridiculed. Second, it is violently opposed. Third, it is accepted.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: Truth is like the sun. You can shut it out for a time, but it ain't going away.
author: Elvis Presley

quote: The truth does not change according to our ability to stomach it.
author: Flannery O'Connor

quote: The naked truth never looks as good as a figleaf.
author: Clark Gable

quote: Take hold of the truth and the truth will set you free.
author: Hosea 4:6

quote: Better to get hurt by the truth than comforted with a lie.
author: Khaled Hosseini

quote: If you do not tell the truth about yourself you cannot tell it about other people.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: The truth is more important than the facts.
author: Frank Lloyd Wright

quote: Truth is the daughter of time, not of authority.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: People like to think they want the truth, but they don't really want it.
author: Megyn Kelly

quote: Truth has a pace of its own. Its messenger may be run over but yet he goes on.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: Truth is not only violated by falsehood; it may be equally outraged by silence.
author: Henri Frederic Amiel

quote: Truth never damages a cause that is just.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: A thing is not necessarily true because a man dies for it.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Seek not to understand that you may believe, but believe that you may understand.
author: Saint Augustine

quote: Truth sits upon the lips of dying men.
author: Aeschylus

quote: Truth springs from arguments among friends.
author: David Hume

quote: The greatest enemy of knowledge is not ignorance, it is the illusion of knowledge.
author: Stephen Hawking

quote: He who permits himself to tell a lie once, finds it much easier to do it a second and third time.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: There is nothing so strong or safe in an emergency of life as the simple truth.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: Truth needs no colorizing.
author: Anthony Trollope

quote: Truth, like gold, is to be obtained not by its growth, but by its purchase.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: By doubting we are led to question, and by questioning we arrive at the truth.
author: Peter Abelard

quote: Sometimes it's easier to tell a lie than explain why it's the truth.
author: Karen Joy Fowler

quote: Lies run sprints, but the truth runs marathons.
author: Voltaire

quote: Truth does not become more true by virtue of the fact that the entire world agrees with it, nor less so even if the whole world disagrees with it.
author: Mohandas K. Gandhi

quote: Nothing in all the world is more dangerous than sincere ignorance and conscientious stupidity.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

quote: To tell the truth is to create the future.
author: Don DeLillo

quote: Every man has a right to his opinion, but no man has a right to be wrong in his facts.
author: Bernard Baruch

quote: Truth is the soul of morality.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Integrity is telling myself the truth. And honesty is telling the truth to other people.
author: Spencer Johnson

quote: A true friend tells the truth about you to you.
author: Johann Georg Zimmermann

quote: Truth is the only safe ground to stand upon.
author: Elizabeth Cady Stanton

quote: Truth is not something outside to be discovered, it is something inside to be realized.
author: Osho

quote: Truth is the property of no individual but is the treasure of all mankind.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Truth is like glass; even if it breaks, it leaves a sharp edge.
author: Olive Schreiner

quote: If you would know the mind of a man, listen to his words.
author: Native American Proverb

quote: Everyone tells the truth, at least, sometimes; only liars change.
author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

quote: Truth is the torch that gleams through the fog without dispelling it.
author: Claude Adrien Helv√©tius

quote: All truths are easy to understand once they are discovered; the point is to discover them.
author: Galileo Galilei

quote: Truth is the right of every human being.
author: Unknown

quote: Without truth and love, we can accomplish nothing.
author: Dorothy Day

quote: The high-minded man must care more for the truth than for what people think.
author: Aristotle

quote: The first casualty of war is truth.
author: Hiram Johnson

quote: There are no facts, only interpretations.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: The great enemy of truth is very often not the lie but the myth.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Truth is ever to be found in simplicity, and not in the multiplicity and confusion of things.
author: Isaac Newton

quote: Truth is the beginning of every good to the gods, and of every good to man.
author: Plato

quote: Truth is decreed by a majority vote.
author: Doug Larson

quote: Truth will always be truth, even if no one believes it.
author: Jerry Falwell

quote: Truth fears no questions.
author: Unknown

quote: By seeking and blundering we learn.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: Sometimes people don't want to hear the truth because they don't want their illusions destroyed.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: A truth that's told with bad intent beats all the lies you can invent.
author: William Blake

quote: Truth is the most valuable thing we have. Let us economize it.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Truth needs no defense.
author: Cato the Elder

quote: The truth is of God and the lie is of the devil.
author: Saint Augustine

quote: The love of truth is the mother of knowledge.
author: Persian Proverb

quote: Truth is immortal; what you sow is what you reap.
author: Rumi

quote: The truth is sold more often than it is bought.
author: Thomas Sowell

quote: Truth and freedom are inseparable.
author: Anonymous

quote: Truth never drowns in countless waves of falsehood.
author: Unknown

quote: Truth is the breath of the real.
author: Ivan Turgenev

quote: There is nothing so easy as to lie.
author: Cicero

quote: We live in the truth with others; we make truth in solitude.
author: Goethe

quote: In seeking truth, you have to get both sides of a story.
author: Walter Cronkite

quote: Truth is the focal point of all learning.
author: Charles William Eliot

quote: Speaking the truth is the main attribute of a pure hearted person.
author: Eraldo Banovac

quote: Truth is not cruel, but people are cruel.
author: Dr. Seuss

quote: Truth is a deep kindness that teaches us to be content in our daily affairs.
author: Unknown

quote: The truth must dazzle gradually or every man be blind.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: Truth is so rare that it is delightful to tell it.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: Truth is the consensus of the wise.
author: Unknown

quote: Truth is heavy; therefore few wear it.
author: Oliver Herford

quote: Light is fast, but truth is faster.
author: Terry Pratchett
